1i8b | These are complex questions with many potential solutions and outcomes. The way forward is to design and execute a comprehensive strategy and blueprint built on the foundations of KPMG's Connected Enterprise for Higher Education framework.
5sfj | How KPMG can help
vk4h | Higher education leaders everywhere are struggling with the same profound questions concerning student experience, staffing, costs, value enhancement and more. KPMG Connected Enterprise for Higher Education is a consumer-centric, enterprise-wide blueprint for digitally transforming universities.
nsm3 | This research-based framework is designed to help position institutions to drive increased value and returns by intentionally designing and aligning the elements of a university to help deliver seamless, consumer-centered experiences.
jdfw | KPMG Connected Enterprise for Higher Education
uc9r | - Helping institutions identify how key organizational elements align with desired consumer experiences
l0ap | - Using target operating models to illustrate the future state of institutions to support sustainable transformation

5xlt | About the author
9bz4 | Stephen began his career in law, working in private practice and academia in the UK. Over the last thirty years he has held a number of high-profile roles in the Australian education sector including the Vice-Chancellor and President, University of Canberra, Senior Deputy Vice-Chancellor and Vice-President, Monash University and most recently, Director of Global, Development and Strategy at The Conversation.
yfv2 | In twenty fourteen, Stephen received the Order of Australia for "distinguished services to tertiary education through administrative, academic and representational roles, and as a leader in the growth and development of the University of Canberra".
pujl | Stephen leads KPMG International's Education and Skills network which spans eleven countries and territories. As KPMG Australia's Special Adviser on Education he continues his passion for Australia's social and economic future through improvements in education and research outcomes. Stephen also leads the firm's work across all parts of the sector including higher education, vocational and training and school education.
